thread.title: The New v3.6 Of HTML5 Video Converter is Out
thread.title_full: The New v3.6 Of HTML5 Video Converter is Out

author: prbuzz.com
title: The New v3.6 Of HTML5 Video Converter is Out
text:
EasyHTML5Video.com finally releases the new v3.6 of HTML5 Video Converter . The innovative user friendly video converter supports multi-threaded video encoding, so as to enable users to quickly convert online videos as per requirement. The presence of a high quality video on the first page of a website enhances the success of any business to several folds. It converts almost any video within minutes for viewing on the latest smart phones and almost any updated viewing device. The application supports users to achieve high quality output with simple steps and make video hosting easier than ever before.
Tom Nowak, CEO of Easy HTML5 Video said in a recent press meet, “EasyHTML5Video provides innovative solution for hassle free video hosting. Users can now easily load videos directly to their own servers within no time.” The new video converter offers important features that include new GUI and updated website, multi-threaded video conversion of up to 8x faster on multi-core processors, added support for over 40+ new video codecs and formats, including the latest vp9 (Google VP9), hevc (H.265), aic (Apple Intermediate Codec) and added "How to insert the video to HTML page" tutorial after the export for ease of use.
The well designed converter is capable to covert over more than 300 video formats from notorious MOV, AVI, MP4 as well as brand-new VP9 and H.265. HTML file videos can be easily created within minutes using three easy steps that include dropping a file, tine setting and publishing. The final created high quality video plays in all latest devices, smart phones and browsers.
Easy HTML5 Video (Eindhoven, North Brabant) started in 2011 with an aim to make video conversions and online video hosting easier. The company has achieved accelerating success since then. At present, over 100,000 websites utilize EasyHTML5Video to independently display videos on their pages.
